transparency.title: How is this calculated?
transparency.intro: Here is the full calculation in plain language.
transparency.ratio: Your {{part}} hours per week are {{pct}} % of {{full}} hours.

step1.title: Step 1: Check the 50% rule
step1.ok: This meets the 50% rule. We can continue.
step1.fail: This is below 50%. Please adjust your hours or talk to your chamber.

step2.title: Step 2: Part-time factor
step2.text: We divide {{part}} hours by {{full}} hours. That gives the part-time factor {{factor}}.

step3.title: Step 3: Base duration
step3.text: Standard duration {{fullM}} months minus school reduction {{degreeM}} months and other reasons {{manualM}} months = {{rawBase}} months. The chamber requires at least {{minM}} months, so we use {{basis}} months ({{basisYM}}).

step4.title: Step 4: New part-time duration
step4.text: We divide the base duration {{basis}} months by the part-time factor {{factor}}. That results in {{dtheo}} months.

step5.title: Step 5: Protective rules
step5.sixApplied: The extension would be {{extension}} months. We limit it and stay at {{limited}} months.
step5.sixSkipped: The extension is {{extension}} months. No limit is needed.
step5.capApplied: After step 4 we would reach {{afterSix}} months, which is more than 1.5 × the standard duration ({{cap}} months). We cap it at {{cap}} months.
step5.capSkipped: The duration stays at {{afterSix}} months and remains below the cap of {{cap}} months.

step6.title: Step 6: Round and present
step6.text: We round {{value}} months with {{rounding}} and get {{rounded}} months ({{roundedYM}}).

error.below50: The requested weekly working time is below 50% of the regular working time. Please check your entries.
